criteria: Understanding of Safe Food Purchasing Practices
Understanding of Safe Food Preparation Practices
Understanding of Safe Food Storage Practices
Application of Knowledge to Prevent Foodborne Illness
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of safe food purchasing practices.
Identifies one or two safe food purchasing practices.
Lists several safe food purchasing practices but lacks detail.
Explains common safe food purchasing practices, such as checking expiration dates and proper packaging.
Describes safe food purchasing practices with specific examples and reasoning.
Thoroughly explains and provides detailed examples of diverse safe food purchasing practices, including considerations for different food types.
Demonstrates no understanding of safe food preparation practices.
Identifies one or two safe food preparation practices.
Lists several safe food preparation practices but lacks detail.
Explains common safe food preparation practices, such as washing hands and preventing cross-contamination.
Describes safe food preparation practices with specific examples and reasoning.
Thoroughly explains and provides detailed examples of diverse safe food preparation practices, including proper cooking temperatures and sanitation.
Demonstrates no understanding of safe food storage practices.
Identifies one or two safe food storage practices.
Lists several safe food storage practices but lacks detail.
Explains common safe food storage practices, such as refrigerating perishable foods and proper labeling.
Describes safe food storage practices with specific examples and reasoning.
Thoroughly explains and provides detailed examples of diverse safe food storage practices, including strategies for different food types and long-term storage.
Does not connect safe food practices to the prevention of foodborne illness.
Makes a weak connection between some practices and illness prevention.
Identifies some connections between practices and illness prevention, but lacks depth.
Explains how each category of safe food practice contributes to preventing foodborne illness.
Provides detailed explanations and examples of how safe food practices directly prevent specific foodborne illnesses.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of how all areas of safe food practices work together to minimize the risk of foodborne illness, including identifying high-risk foods and populations.
